text:
New General Manager appointed for Hilton Surfers Paradise
Hilton Worldwide has announced the appointment of Fiona Pryde as general manager, Hilton Surfers Paradise. In her new role, Pryde will take responsibility for the 419 room combined hotel and residences property on Queensland’s Gold Coast.
Pryde has more than 19 years’ experience in the hospitality industry. She commenced her career in food and beverage and progressed through roles in front office, revenue management and sales and marketing before her first general manager appointment in 2009.
Throughout her career, Pryde has completed a variety of assignments in Brisbane and the Northern Territory, and most recently held the position of cluster director, business development – Northern Territory. In this role she managed Hilton Darwin, and three DoubleTree by Hilton properties in Darwin and Alice Springs.
Pryde is delighted to return to her home state of Queensland and believes the Gold Coast will continue to see positive growth as a business, event and holiday destination.
“I am pleased to be working with such a dynamic team and represent our flagship leisure property in this vibrant and diverse marketplace.
“Hilton Surfers Paradise has celebrated great success in its four years since opening. I look forward to being part of our next milestones and achievements, as we continue to drive a culture of innovation, whilst honoring the traditional style of Hilton.”
For the second year running, Hilton Worldwide has been named in Universum’s ‘Most Attractive Employers’ in the Asia Pacific region. Fiona’s appointment is a testament to Hilton Worldwide’s effort to groom talented team members and provide them with the opportunity to grow their careers within the organisation.
